question.short: What are the effects of sexual education programs?
question.long: What is the risk-benefit ratio of sexual education programs for children?

description: Results from studies evaluating the risk-benefit ratio of sexual education programs for children aimed at preventing child sexual abuse.

no_consensus.description: The literature has not yet reached a consensus on the effects of sexual education programs

positive.description: The literature suggests that sexual education programs mostly have positive effects on children

no_effect.description: The literature suggests that sexual education programs have no significant effect on children

negative.description: The literature suggests that sexual education programs mostly have negative effects on children

positive.description: The results of the paper suggest that the sexual education programs evaluated mostly have positive effects on children

positive_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper suggest that the sexual education programs evaluated mostly have positive effects on children, unlike what is reported in the literature

no_effect.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect on children of the sexual education programs evaluated

negative_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper suggest that the sexual education programs evaluated mostly have negative effects on children, unlike what is reported in the literature

negative.description: The results of the paper suggest that the sexual education programs evaluated mostly have negative effects on children

papers.title: Evaluation of a brief intervention for educating school children in awareness of physical and sexual abuse
papers.quote: Relative to controls, children who received the program showed an overall increase in knowledge of correct actions to take in the event of potential or actual abuse.
